Operation 'Upsert' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary 'Upsert' is too vague and not action-oriented. Description lacks critical details about inputs (batch format, metadata support), outputs (return value), and side effects (overwrites existing data, namespace scoping, batch behavior). Enhanced version clarifies the operation's dual nature (create/update), specifies what gets overwritten, explains input structure, describes return value, and notes namespace isolation for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: The Upsert operation writes vectors into a namespace. If a new value is upserted for an existing vector id, it will overwrite the previous value.
data.summary_suggestion: Write or update vectors in a namespace
data.description_suggestion: Writes vectors into a specified namespace, creating new vector entries or updating existing ones. If a vector with the same ID already exists, its dense data, sparse data, and metadata will be overwritten with the provided values. Accepts a batch of vectors with IDs, dense/sparse data, and optional metadata. Returns the count of successfully upserted vectors. Operates within a single namespace and supports partial batch failures.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Upsert' is too vague and not action-oriented. Description lacks critical details about inputs (batch format, metadata support), outputs (return value), and side effects (overwrites existing data, namespace scoping, batch behavior). Enhanced version clarifies the operation's dual nature (create/update), specifies what gets overwritten, explains input structure, describes return value, and notes namespace isolation for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'create_collection' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description is too minimal. Added details about required inputs (CollectionDefinition), what the operation returns (collection object with metadata), and side effects (collection becomes available). This helps AI agents understand what parameters to provide and what to expect in the response.

data.current_description: This operation creates a Pinecone collection.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Pinecone collection from a collection definition. Requires a CollectionDefinition object specifying the collection name and source index. Returns the created collection object with metadata including creation timestamp and status. The collection becomes available for use immediately after creation.
data.reasoning: Original description is too minimal. Added details about required inputs (CollectionDefinition), what the operation returns (collection object with metadata), and side effects (collection becomes available). This helps AI agents understand what parameters to provide and what to expect in the response.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific collection by name. Requires the collection name as a path parameter. message: Operation 'delete_collection' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. Original description is too brief and lacks critical information. data.current_description: This operation deletes an existing collection.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a collection by name, permanently removing it and all associated metadata. Requires the collection name as a path parameter. This operation cannot be undone. Returns a success response with no body content (204 No Content). All references to the deleted collection become invalid.
data.reasoning: Original description is too brief and lacks critical information. Added details about the required collectionName parameter, the permanent nature of deletion, the response format, and side effects (invalidating references). This is crucial for AI agents to understand the destructive nature of this operation.

message: Operation 'create_index' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Original description mentions configurable parameters but lacks specificity about what is actually returned and the index lifecycle. Enhanced version clarifies the IndexDefinition input structure, specific configurable parameters with examples, the response format, and the initialization process. This helps AI agents understand the full scope of index creation.

data.current_description: This operation creates a Pinecone index. You can use it to specify the measure of similarity, the dimension of vectors to be stored in the index, the numbers of replicas to use, and more.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Pinecone index with specified configuration. Accepts an IndexDefinition object to configure the index name, vector dimensionality, similarity metric (e.g., cosine, euclidean, dotproduct), pod type, number of replicas, and other parameters. Returns the created index object with status and configuration details. The index becomes ready for vector operations once initialization completes.
data.reasoning: Original description mentions configurable parameters but lacks specificity about what is actually returned and the index lifecycle. Enhanced version clarifies the IndexDefinition input structure, specific configurable parameters with examples, the response format, and the initialization process. This helps AI agents understand the full scope of index creation.

data.current_description: This operation deletes an existing index.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an existing index and all associated data. This operation permanently removes the index specified by indexName, including all vectors, metadata, and namespaces within it. The operation cannot be undone. Requires appropriate API key authentication.

message: Operation 'configure_index' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description lacks detail about what happens during configuration changes, return value, and input requirements. Enhanced version clarifies side effects (temporary unavailability), expected inputs (IndexConfiguration), and outputs for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: This operation specifies the pod type and number of replicas for an index.
data.description_suggestion: Modifies the pod type and replica configuration of an existing index. Updates the index's infrastructure settings including pod type and number of replicas. Changes take effect immediately and may cause temporary unavailability during reconfiguration. Returns the updated index configuration. Requires the IndexConfiguration request body with desired pod type and replica count.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks detail about what happens during configuration changes, return value, and input requirements. Enhanced version clarifies side effects (temporary unavailability), expected inputs (IndexConfiguration), and outputs for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: The `DescribeIndexStats` operation returns statistics about the index's contents, including the vector count per namespace and the number of dimensions.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve index statistics and vector counts
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves comprehensive statistics about an index's contents. Returns vector count per namespace, total vector count, and index dimensionality. Accepts a DescribeIndexStatsRequest specifying the target namespace (optional - if omitted, returns stats for all namespaces). Useful for monitoring index health and capacity.
data.reasoning: Summary was too generic. Description lacked clarity about input parameters (namespace specification) and what happens when namespace is omitted. Enhanced version clarifies optional namespace parameter behavior and use cases for AI agents.

message: Operation 'Query' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary was too vague. Description missed critical input details (query vector format, namespace, optional parameters like top-k and filters) and output details (what metadata is returned). Enhanced version provides comprehensive parameter and return information for AI agents to understand when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description: The `Query` operation searches a namespace, using a query vector. It retrieves the ids of the most similar items in a namespace, along with their similarity scores.
data.summary_suggestion: Search for similar vectors by query vector
data.description_suggestion: Searches a namespace for vectors most similar to a query vector using the index's configured similarity metric. Accepts a QueryRequest containing the query vector (dense and/or sparse), target namespace, and optional parameters like top-k result count, metadata filters, and whether to include vector data. Returns matching vector IDs, similarity scores, and optionally the vector data and metadata. Supports metadata filtering to constrain results.
data.reasoning: Original summary was too vague. Description missed critical input details (query vector format, namespace, optional parameters like top-k and filters) and output details (what metadata is returned). Enhanced version provides comprehensive parameter and return information for AI agents to understand when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'Delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary was too generic. Description was repetitive and lacked important details: input structure (DeleteRequest), optional filtering capability, permanence of deletion, and scope clarification (single namespace only). Enhanced version provides actionable details for AI agents.

data.current_description: The `Delete` operation deletes vectors, by id, from a single namespace. You can delete items by their id, from a single namespace.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete vectors by ID from namespace
data.description_suggestion: Deletes one or more vectors from a specified namespace by their vector IDs. Accepts a DeleteRequest containing vector IDs to delete and the target namespace. Supports optional metadata filters to selectively delete vectors matching specific criteria. Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone. Returns confirmation of deletion. Does not affect vectors in other namespaces.
data.reasoning: Summary was too generic. Description was repetitive and lacked important details: input structure (DeleteRequest), optional filtering capability, permanence of deletion, and scope clarification (single namespace only). Enhanced version provides actionable details for AI agents.

message: Operation 'Fetch' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary was too vague. Description lacked input details (FetchRequest structure, namespace specification) and was unclear about what metadata is returned. Enhanced version clarifies input requirements, return value structure, and use cases for AI agents.

data.current_description: The `Fetch` operation looks up and returns vectors, by ID, from a single namespace. The returned vectors include the vector data and/or metadata.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve vectors by ID from namespace
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves one or more vectors from a specified namespace by their vector IDs. Accepts a FetchRequest containing the vector IDs to retrieve and target namespace. Returns the requested vectors including their dense vector data, sparse vector data (if present), and associated metadata. Useful for retrieving specific vectors after a query or for data inspection. Returns empty results for non-existent vector IDs.
data.reasoning: Summary was too vague. Description lacked input details (FetchRequest structure, namespace specification) and was unclear about what metadata is returned. Enhanced version clarifies input requirements, return value structure, and use cases for AI agents.

message: Operation 'Update' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, inconsistent_terminology, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary incorrectly said 'Fetch' (copy-paste error). Description used inconsistent terminology ('vector' vs 'vectors', unclear 'value' reference) and lacked input structure details (UpdateRequest). Enhanced version corrects the summary, clarifies the merge behavior for metadata vs overwrite for vectors, specifies input requirements, and improves clarity for AI agents.

data.current_description: The `Update` operation updates vector in a namespace. If a value is included, it will overwrite the previous value. If a set_metadata is included, the values of the fields specified in it will be added or overwrite the previous value.
data.description_suggestion: Updates one or more vectors in a specified namespace. Accepts an UpdateRequest containing vector ID, updated vector values (dense and/or sparse), and/or metadata updates. Vector values overwrite previous values completely. Metadata updates merge with existing metadata - specified fields are added or overwritten while unspecified fields remain unchanged. Supports updating vector data, metadata, or both. Returns confirmation of update. Target namespace must be specified in the request.
data.reasoning: Summary incorrectly said 'Fetch' (copy-paste error). Description used inconsistent terminology ('vector' vs 'vectors', unclear 'value' reference) and lacked input structure details (UpdateRequest). Enhanced version corrects the summary, clarifies the merge behavior for metadata vs overwrite for vectors, specifies input requirements, and improves clarity for AI agents.
